trans-unit.source: Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure (PowerShell)
trans-unit.target: Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure (PowerShell)

trans-unit.source: Use PowerShell to create an AlwaysOn Availability Group in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Use PowerShell to create an AlwaysOn Availability Group in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure (PowerShell)
trans-unit.target: Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure (PowerShell)

trans-unit.source: For the GUI-based tutorial of the same scenario, see <link><linkText>Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure (GUI)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For the GUI-based tutorial of the same scenario, see <link><linkText>Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure (GUI)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Azure virtual machines (VMs) can help database administrators to implement lower the cost of a high availability SQL Server system.
trans-unit.target: Azure virtual machines (VMs) can help database administrators to implement lower the cost of a high availability SQL Server system.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to implement an availability group using SQL Server AlwaysOn end-to-end inside an Azure environment.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to implement an availability group using SQL Server AlwaysOn end-to-end inside an Azure environment.

trans-unit.source: At the end of the tutorial, your SQL Server AlwaysOn solution in Azure will consist of the following elements:
trans-unit.target: At the end of the tutorial, your SQL Server AlwaysOn solution in Azure will consist of the following elements:

trans-unit.source: A virtual network containing multiple subnets, including a front-end and a back-end subnet
trans-unit.target: A virtual network containing multiple subnets, including a front-end and a back-end subnet

trans-unit.source: A domain controller with an Active Directory (AD) domain
trans-unit.target: A domain controller with an Active Directory (AD) domain

trans-unit.source: Two SQL Server VMs deployed to the back-end subnet and joined to the AD domain
trans-unit.target: Two SQL Server VMs deployed to the back-end subnet and joined to the AD domain

trans-unit.source: A 3-node WSFC cluster with the Node Majority quorum model
trans-unit.target: A 3-node WSFC cluster with the Node Majority quorum model

trans-unit.source: An availability group with two synchronous-commit replicas of an availability database
trans-unit.target: An availability group with two synchronous-commit replicas of an availability database

trans-unit.source: This scenario is chosen for its simplicity, not for its cost effectiveness or other factors on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This scenario is chosen for its simplicity, not for its cost effectiveness or other factors on Azure.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can minimize the number of VMs for a two-replica availability group in order to save on compute hours in Azure by using the domain controller as the quorum file share witness in a 2-node WSFC cluster.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can minimize the number of VMs for a two-replica availability group in order to save on compute hours in Azure by using the domain controller as the quorum file share witness in a 2-node WSFC cluster.

trans-unit.source: This method reduces the VM count by one from the above configuration.
trans-unit.target: This method reduces the VM count by one from the above configuration.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is intended to show you the steps required to set up the described solution above without elaborating on the details of each step.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is intended to show you the steps required to set up the described solution above without elaborating on the details of each step.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, instead of showing you the GUI configuration steps, it uses PowerShell scripting to take you quickly through each step.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, instead of showing you the GUI configuration steps, it uses PowerShell scripting to take you quickly through each step.

trans-unit.source: It assumes the following:
trans-unit.target: It assumes the following:

trans-unit.source: You already have an Azure account with the virtual machine subscription.
trans-unit.target: You already have an Azure account with the virtual machine subscription.

trans-unit.source: You have installed the <link><linkText>Azure PowerShell cmdlets</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You have installed the <link><linkText>Azure PowerShell cmdlets</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You already know how to provision a SQL Server VM from the virtual machine gallery using the GUI.
trans-unit.target: You already know how to provision a SQL Server VM from the virtual machine gallery using the GUI.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: You already have a solid understanding of AlwaysOn Availability Groups for on-premise solutions.
trans-unit.target: You already have a solid understanding of AlwaysOn Availability Groups for on-premise solutions.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>AlwaysOn Availability Groups (SQL Server)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>AlwaysOn Availability Groups (SQL Server)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Connect to Your Azure Subscription and Create the Virtual Network
trans-unit.target: Connect to Your Azure Subscription and Create the Virtual Network

trans-unit.source: In a PowerShell window on your local computer, import the Azure module, download a publishing settings file to your machine, and connect your PowerShell session to your Azure subscription by importing the downloaded publishing settings.
trans-unit.target: In a PowerShell window on your local computer, import the Azure module, download a publishing settings file to your machine, and connect your PowerShell session to your Azure subscription by importing the downloaded publishing settings.

trans-unit.source: The Get-AzurePublishgSettingsFile command automatically generates a management certificate with Azure downloads it to your machine.
trans-unit.target: The Get-AzurePublishgSettingsFile command automatically generates a management certificate with Azure downloads it to your machine.

trans-unit.source: A browser will be automatically opened and you are prompted to enter the Microsoft account credentials for your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: A browser will be automatically opened and you are prompted to enter the Microsoft account credentials for your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: The downloaded .publishsettings file contains all the information you need to manage your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: The downloaded .publishsettings file contains all the information you need to manage your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: After saving this file to a local directory, import it using the Import-AzurePublishSettingsFile command.
trans-unit.target: After saving this file to a local directory, import it using the Import-AzurePublishSettingsFile command.

trans-unit.source: The publishsettings file contains your credentials (unencoded) that are used to administer your Azure subscriptions and services.
trans-unit.target: The publishsettings file contains your credentials (unencoded) that are used to administer your Azure subscriptions and services.

trans-unit.source: The security best practice for this file is to store it temporarily outside your source directories (for example in the Libraries\Documents folder), and then delete it once the import has completed.
trans-unit.target: The security best practice for this file is to store it temporarily outside your source directories (for example in the Libraries\Documents folder), and then delete it once the import has completed.

trans-unit.source: A malicious user gaining access to the publishsettings file can edit, create, and delete your Azure services.
trans-unit.target: A malicious user gaining access to the publishsettings file can edit, create, and delete your Azure services.

trans-unit.source: Define a series of variables that you will use to create your cloud IT infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Define a series of variables that you will use to create your cloud IT infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Pay attention to the following to ensure that your commands will succeed later:
trans-unit.target: Pay attention to the following to ensure that your commands will succeed later:

trans-unit.source: Variables $storageAccountName and $dcServiceName must be unique because they are used to identify your cloud storage account and cloud server, respectively, on the internet.
trans-unit.target: Variables $storageAccountName and $dcServiceName must be unique because they are used to identify your cloud storage account and cloud server, respectively, on the internet.

trans-unit.source: Names specified for variables $affinityGroupName and $virtualNetworkName are configured in the virtual network configuration document that you will use later.
trans-unit.target: Names specified for variables $affinityGroupName and $virtualNetworkName are configured in the virtual network configuration document that you will use later.

trans-unit.source: $sqlImageName specifies the updated name of the VM image that contains SQL Server 2012 Service Pack 1 Enterprise Edition.
trans-unit.target: $sqlImageName specifies the updated name of the VM image that contains SQL Server 2012 Service Pack 1 Enterprise Edition.

trans-unit.source: For simplicity, Contoso!000 is the same password used throughout the entire tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For simplicity, Contoso!000 is the same password used throughout the entire tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Create an affinity group.
trans-unit.target: Create an affinity group.

trans-unit.source: Create a virtual network by importing a configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Create a virtual network by importing a configuration file.

trans-unit.source: The configuration file contains the following XML document.
trans-unit.target: The configuration file contains the following XML document.

trans-unit.source: In brief, it specifies a virtual network called ContosoNET in the affinity group called ContosoAG, and it has the address space 10.10.0.0/16 and has two subnets, 10.10.1.0/24 and 10.10.2.0/24, which are the front subnet and back subnet, respectively.
trans-unit.target: In brief, it specifies a virtual network called ContosoNET in the affinity group called ContosoAG, and it has the address space 10.10.0.0/16 and has two subnets, 10.10.1.0/24 and 10.10.2.0/24, which are the front subnet and back subnet, respectively.

trans-unit.source: The front subnet is where you can place client applications such as Microsoft SharePoint, and the back subnet is where you will place the SQL Server VMs.
trans-unit.target: The front subnet is where you can place client applications such as Microsoft SharePoint, and the back subnet is where you will place the SQL Server VMs.

trans-unit.source: If you change the $affinityGroupName and $virtualNetworkName variables earlier, you must also change the corresponding names below.
trans-unit.target: If you change the $affinityGroupName and $virtualNetworkName variables earlier, you must also change the corresponding names below.

trans-unit.source: Create a storage account that is associated with the affinity group you created and set it as the current storage account in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Create a storage account that is associated with the affinity group you created and set it as the current storage account in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: Create the DC server in new cloud service and availability set.
trans-unit.target: Create the DC server in new cloud service and availability set.

trans-unit.source: This series of piped commands do the following things:
trans-unit.target: This series of piped commands do the following things:

trans-unit.source: New-AzureVMConfig creates a VM configuration.
trans-unit.target: New-AzureVMConfig creates a VM configuration.

trans-unit.source: Add-AzureProvisioningConfig gives the configuration parameters of a standalone Windows server.
trans-unit.target: Add-AzureProvisioningConfig gives the configuration parameters of a standalone Windows server.

trans-unit.source: Add-AzureDataDisk adds the data disk that you will use for storing Active Directory data, with caching option set to None.
trans-unit.target: Add-AzureDataDisk adds the data disk that you will use for storing Active Directory data, with caching option set to None.

trans-unit.source: New-AzureVM creates a new cloud service and creates the new Azure VM in the new cloud service.
trans-unit.target: New-AzureVM creates a new cloud service and creates the new Azure VM in the new cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the new VM to be fully provisioned and download the remote desktop file to your working directory.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the new VM to be fully provisioned and download the remote desktop file to your working directory.

trans-unit.source: Since the new Azure VM takes a long time to provision, the while loop continues to poll the new VM until it is ready for use.
trans-unit.target: Since the new Azure VM takes a long time to provision, the while loop continues to poll the new VM until it is ready for use.

trans-unit.source: The DC server is now successfully provisioned.
trans-unit.target: The DC server is now successfully provisioned.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will configure the Active Directory domain on this DC server.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will configure the Active Directory domain on this DC server.

trans-unit.source: Leave the PowerShell window open on your local computer.
trans-unit.target: Leave the PowerShell window open on your local computer.

trans-unit.source: You will use it again later to create the two SQL Server VMs.
trans-unit.target: You will use it again later to create the two SQL Server VMs.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Domain Controller
trans-unit.target: Configure the Domain Controller

trans-unit.source: Connect to the DC server by launching the remote desktop file.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the DC server by launching the remote desktop file.

trans-unit.source: Use the machine administrator’s username AzureAdmin and password Contoso!000, which you specified when creating the new VM.
trans-unit.target: Use the machine administrator’s username AzureAdmin and password Contoso!000, which you specified when creating the new VM.

trans-unit.source: Open a PowerShell window in administrator mode.
trans-unit.target: Open a PowerShell window in administrator mode.

trans-unit.source: Run the following DCPROMO.EXE command to setup the corp.contoso.com domain, with the data directories on drive M.
trans-unit.target: Run the following DCPROMO.EXE command to setup the corp.contoso.com domain, with the data directories on drive M.

trans-unit.source: Once the command completes, the VM restarts automatically.
trans-unit.target: Once the command completes, the VM restarts automatically.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the DC server again by launching the remote desktop file.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the DC server again by launching the remote desktop file.

trans-unit.source: This time, log in as CORP\Administrator.
trans-unit.target: This time, log in as CORP\Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Open a PowerShell window in administrator mode and import the Active Directory PowerShell module using the following command:
trans-unit.target: Open a PowerShell window in administrator mode and import the Active Directory PowerShell module using the following command:

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to add three users to the domain.
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to add three users to the domain.

trans-unit.source: CORP\Install is used to configure everything related to the SQL Server service instances, the WSFC cluster, and the availability group.
trans-unit.target: CORP\Install is used to configure everything related to the SQL Server service instances, the WSFC cluster, and the availability group.

trans-unit.source: CORP\SQLSvc1 and CORP\SQLSvc2 are used as the SQL Server service accounts for the two SQL Server VMs.
trans-unit.target: CORP\SQLSvc1 and CORP\SQLSvc2 are used as the SQL Server service accounts for the two SQL Server VMs.

trans-unit.source: Next, run the following commands to give CORP\Install the permissions to create computer objects in the domain.
trans-unit.target: Next, run the following commands to give CORP\Install the permissions to create computer objects in the domain.

trans-unit.source: The GUID specified above is the GUID for the computer object type.
trans-unit.target: The GUID specified above is the GUID for the computer object type.

trans-unit.source: The CORP\Install account needs the Read All Properties and Create Computer Objects permission in order to create the Active Direct objects for the WSFC cluster.
trans-unit.target: The CORP\Install account needs the Read All Properties and Create Computer Objects permission in order to create the Active Direct objects for the WSFC cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Read All Properties permission is already given to CORP\Install by default, so you do not need to grant it explicitly.
trans-unit.target: The Read All Properties permission is already given to CORP\Install by default, so you do not need to grant it explicitly.

trans-unit.source: For more information on permissions needed to create the WSFC cluster, see <link><linkText>Failover Cluster Step-by-Step Guide: Configuring Accounts in Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on permissions needed to create the WSFC cluster, see <link><linkText>Failover Cluster Step-by-Step Guide: Configuring Accounts in Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have finished configuring Active Directory and the user objects, you will create two SQL Server VMs and join them to this domain.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have finished configuring Active Directory and the user objects, you will create two SQL Server VMs and join them to this domain.

trans-unit.source: Create the SQL Server VMs
trans-unit.target: Create the SQL Server VMs

trans-unit.source: Continue to use the PowerShell window that is open on your local computer.
trans-unit.target: Continue to use the PowerShell window that is open on your local computer.

trans-unit.source: Define the following additional variables:
trans-unit.target: Define the following additional variables:

trans-unit.source: The IP address 10.10.0.4 is typically assigned to the first VM you create in the 10.10.0.0/16 subnet of your Azure virtual network.
trans-unit.target: The IP address 10.10.0.4 is typically assigned to the first VM you create in the 10.10.0.0/16 subnet of your Azure virtual network.

trans-unit.source: You should verify this is the address of your DC server by running IPCONFIG.
trans-unit.target: You should verify this is the address of your DC server by running IPCONFIG.

trans-unit.source: Run the following piped commands to create the first VM in the WSFC cluster, named ContosoQuorum:
trans-unit.target: Run the following piped commands to create the first VM in the WSFC cluster, named ContosoQuorum:

trans-unit.source: Note the following regarding the command above:
trans-unit.target: Note the following regarding the command above:

trans-unit.source: New-AzureVMConfig creates a VM configuration with the desired availability set name.
trans-unit.target: New-AzureVMConfig creates a VM configuration with the desired availability set name.

trans-unit.source: The subsequent VMs will be created with the same availability set name so that they are joined to the same availability set.
trans-unit.target: The subsequent VMs will be created with the same availability set name so that they are joined to the same availability set.

trans-unit.source: Add-AzureProvisioningConfig joins the VM to the Active Directory domain you created.
trans-unit.target: Add-AzureProvisioningConfig joins the VM to the Active Directory domain you created.

trans-unit.source: Set-AzureSubnet places the VM in the Back subnet.
trans-unit.target: Set-AzureSubnet places the VM in the Back subnet.

trans-unit.source: New-AzureVM creates a new cloud service and creates the new Azure VM in the new cloud service.
trans-unit.target: New-AzureVM creates a new cloud service and creates the new Azure VM in the new cloud service.

trans-unit.source: The DnsSettings parameter specifies that the DNS server for the servers in the new cloud service has the IP address 10.10.0.4, which is the IP address of the DC server.
trans-unit.target: The DnsSettings parameter specifies that the DNS server for the servers in the new cloud service has the IP address 10.10.0.4, which is the IP address of the DC server.

trans-unit.source: This parameter is needed to enable the new VMs in the cloud service to join to the Active Directory domain successfully.
trans-unit.target: This parameter is needed to enable the new VMs in the cloud service to join to the Active Directory domain successfully.

trans-unit.source: Without this parameter, you must manually set the IPv4 settings in your VM to use the DC server as the primary DNS server after the VM is provisioned and then join the VM to the Active Directory domain.
trans-unit.target: Without this parameter, you must manually set the IPv4 settings in your VM to use the DC server as the primary DNS server after the VM is provisioned and then join the VM to the Active Directory domain.

trans-unit.source: Run the following piped commands to create the SQL Server VMs, named ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2.
trans-unit.target: Run the following piped commands to create the SQL Server VMs, named ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2.

trans-unit.source: Note the following regarding the commands above:
trans-unit.target: Note the following regarding the commands above:

trans-unit.source: New-AzureVMConfig uses the same availability set name as the DC server, and uses the SQL Server 2012 Service Pack 1 Enterprise Edition image in the virtual machine gallery.
trans-unit.target: New-AzureVMConfig uses the same availability set name as the DC server, and uses the SQL Server 2012 Service Pack 1 Enterprise Edition image in the virtual machine gallery.

trans-unit.source: It also sets the operating system disk to read-caching only (no write caching).
trans-unit.target: It also sets the operating system disk to read-caching only (no write caching).

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you migrate the database files to a separate data disk that you attach to the VM and configure it with no read or write caching.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you migrate the database files to a separate data disk that you attach to the VM and configure it with no read or write caching.

trans-unit.source: However, the next best thing is to remove write caching on the operating system disk, since you cannot remove read caching on the operating system disk.
trans-unit.target: However, the next best thing is to remove write caching on the operating system disk, since you cannot remove read caching on the operating system disk.

trans-unit.source: Add-AzureProvisioningConfig joins the VM to the Active Directory domain you created.
trans-unit.target: Add-AzureProvisioningConfig joins the VM to the Active Directory domain you created.

trans-unit.source: Set-AzureSubnet places the VM in the Back subnet.
trans-unit.target: Set-AzureSubnet places the VM in the Back subnet.

trans-unit.source: Add-AzureEndpoint adds access endpoints so that client applications can access these SQL Server services instances on the internet.
trans-unit.target: Add-AzureEndpoint adds access endpoints so that client applications can access these SQL Server services instances on the internet.

trans-unit.source: Different ports are given to ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2.
trans-unit.target: Different ports are given to ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2.

trans-unit.source: New-AzureVM creates the new SQL Server VM in the same cloud service as ContosoQuorum.
trans-unit.target: New-AzureVM creates the new SQL Server VM in the same cloud service as ContosoQuorum.

trans-unit.source: You must place the VMs in the same cloud service if you want them to be in the same availability set.
trans-unit.target: You must place the VMs in the same cloud service if you want them to be in the same availability set.

trans-unit.source: Wait for each VM to be fully provisioned and download its remote desktop file to your working directory.
trans-unit.target: Wait for each VM to be fully provisioned and download its remote desktop file to your working directory.

trans-unit.source: The for loop cycles through the three new VMs and executes the commands inside the top-level curly brackets for each of them.
trans-unit.target: The for loop cycles through the three new VMs and executes the commands inside the top-level curly brackets for each of them.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Server VMs are now provisioned and running, but they are installed with SQL Server with default options.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Server VMs are now provisioned and running, but they are installed with SQL Server with default options.

trans-unit.source: Initialize the WSFC Cluster VMs
trans-unit.target: Initialize the WSFC Cluster VMs

trans-unit.source: In this section, you need to modify the three servers you will use in the WSFC cluster and the SQL Server installation.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you need to modify the three servers you will use in the WSFC cluster and the SQL Server installation.

trans-unit.source: Specifically:
trans-unit.target: Specifically:

trans-unit.source: (All servers) You need to install the Failover Clustering feature.
trans-unit.target: (All servers) You need to install the Failover Clustering feature.

trans-unit.source: (All servers) You need to add CORP\Install as the machine administrator.
trans-unit.target: (All servers) You need to add CORP\Install as the machine administrator.

trans-unit.source: (ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2 only) You need to add CORP\Install as a sysadmin role in the default database.
trans-unit.target: (ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2 only) You need to add CORP\Install as a sysadmin role in the default database.

trans-unit.source: (ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2 only) You need to add NT AUTHORITY\System as a login with the following permissions:
trans-unit.target: (ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2 only) You need to add NT AUTHORITY\System as a login with the following permissions:

trans-unit.source: Alter any availability group
trans-unit.target: Alter any availability group

trans-unit.source: Connect SQL
trans-unit.target: Connect SQL

trans-unit.source: View server state
trans-unit.target: View server state

trans-unit.source: (ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2 only) The TCP protocol is already enabled on the SQL Server VM.
trans-unit.target: (ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2 only) The TCP protocol is already enabled on the SQL Server VM.

trans-unit.source: However, you still need to open the firewall for remote access of SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: However, you still need to open the firewall for remote access of SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Now, you are ready to start.
trans-unit.target: Now, you are ready to start.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with ContosoQuorum, follow the steps below:
trans-unit.target: Beginning with ContosoQuorum, follow the steps below:

trans-unit.source: Connect to ContosoQuorum by launching the remote desktop files.
trans-unit.target: Connect to ContosoQuorum by launching the remote desktop files.

trans-unit.source: Use the machine administrator’s username AzureAdmin and password Contoso!000, which you specified when creating the VMs.
trans-unit.target: Use the machine administrator’s username AzureAdmin and password Contoso!000, which you specified when creating the VMs.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the computers have been successfully joined to corp.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the computers have been successfully joined to corp.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the SQL Server installation to finish running the automated initialization tasks before proceeding.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the SQL Server installation to finish running the automated initialization tasks before proceeding.

trans-unit.source: Open a PowerShell window in administrator mode.
trans-unit.target: Open a PowerShell window in administrator mode.

trans-unit.source: Install the Windows Failover Clustering feature.
trans-unit.target: Install the Windows Failover Clustering feature.

trans-unit.source: Add CORP\Install as local administrator.
trans-unit.target: Add CORP\Install as local administrator.

trans-unit.source: Log out of ContosoQuorum.
trans-unit.target: Log out of ContosoQuorum.

trans-unit.source: You are done with this server now.
trans-unit.target: You are done with this server now.

trans-unit.source: Next, initialize ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2.
trans-unit.target: Next, initialize ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps below, which are identical for both of the SQL Server VMs.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps below, which are identical for both of the SQL Server VMs.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the two SQL Server VMs by launching the remote desktop files.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the two SQL Server VMs by launching the remote desktop files.

trans-unit.source: Use the machine administrator’s username AzureAdmin and password Contoso!000, which you specified when creating the VMs.
trans-unit.target: Use the machine administrator’s username AzureAdmin and password Contoso!000, which you specified when creating the VMs.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the computers have been successfully joined to corp.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the computers have been successfully joined to corp.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the SQL Server installation to finish running the automated initialization tasks before proceeding.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the SQL Server installation to finish running the automated initialization tasks before proceeding.

trans-unit.source: Open a PowerShell window in administrator mode.
trans-unit.target: Open a PowerShell window in administrator mode.

trans-unit.source: Install the Windows Failover Clustering feature.
trans-unit.target: Install the Windows Failover Clustering feature.

trans-unit.source: Add CORP\Install as local administrator
trans-unit.target: Add CORP\Install as local administrator

trans-unit.source: Import the SQL Server PowerShell Provider.
trans-unit.target: Import the SQL Server PowerShell Provider.

trans-unit.source: Add CORP\Install as the sysadmin role for the default SQL Server instance.
trans-unit.target: Add CORP\Install as the sysadmin role for the default SQL Server instance.

trans-unit.source: Add NT AUTHORITY\System as a login with the three permissions described above.
trans-unit.target: Add NT AUTHORITY\System as a login with the three permissions described above.

trans-unit.source: Open the firewall for remote access of SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Open the firewall for remote access of SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Log out of both VMs.
trans-unit.target: Log out of both VMs.

trans-unit.source: Finally, you are ready to configure the availability group.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you are ready to configure the availability group.

trans-unit.source: You will use the SQL Server PowerShell Provider to perform all of the work on ContosoSQL1.
trans-unit.target: You will use the SQL Server PowerShell Provider to perform all of the work on ContosoSQL1.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Availability Group
trans-unit.target: Configure the Availability Group

trans-unit.source: Connect to ContosoSQL1 again by launching the remote desktop files.
trans-unit.target: Connect to ContosoSQL1 again by launching the remote desktop files.

trans-unit.source: Instead of logging in using the machine account, log in using CORP\Install.
trans-unit.target: Instead of logging in using the machine account, log in using CORP\Install.

trans-unit.source: Open a PowerShell window in administrator mode.
trans-unit.target: Open a PowerShell window in administrator mode.

trans-unit.source: Define the following variables:
trans-unit.target: Define the following variables:

trans-unit.source: Import SQL Server PowerShell Provider.
trans-unit.target: Import SQL Server PowerShell Provider.

trans-unit.source: Change the SQL Server service account for ContosoSQL1 to CORP\SQLSvc1.
trans-unit.target: Change the SQL Server service account for ContosoSQL1 to CORP\SQLSvc1.

trans-unit.source: Change the SQL Server service account for ContosoSQL2 to CORP\SQLSvc2.
trans-unit.target: Change the SQL Server service account for ContosoSQL2 to CORP\SQLSvc2.

trans-unit.source: Download CreateAzureFailoverCluster.ps1 from Create WSFC Cluster for AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure VM to the local working directory.
trans-unit.target: Download CreateAzureFailoverCluster.ps1 from Create WSFC Cluster for AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure VM to the local working directory.

trans-unit.source: You will use this script to help you create a functional WSFC cluster.
trans-unit.target: You will use this script to help you create a functional WSFC cluster.

trans-unit.source: For important information on how WSFC interacts with the Azure network, see <link><linkText>High Availability and Disaster Recovery for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For important information on how WSFC interacts with the Azure network, see <link><linkText>High Availability and Disaster Recovery for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Change to your working directory and create the WSFC cluster with the downloaded script.
trans-unit.target: Change to your working directory and create the WSFC cluster with the downloaded script.

trans-unit.source: Enable AlwaysOn Availability Groups for the default SQL Server instances on ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2.
trans-unit.target: Enable AlwaysOn Availability Groups for the default SQL Server instances on ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2.

trans-unit.source: Create a backup directory and grant permissions for the SQL Server service accounts.
trans-unit.target: Create a backup directory and grant permissions for the SQL Server service accounts.

trans-unit.source: You will use this directory to prepare the availability database on the secondary replica.
trans-unit.target: You will use this directory to prepare the availability database on the secondary replica.

trans-unit.source: Create a database on ContosoSQL1 called MyDB1, take both a full backup and a log backup, and restore them on ContosoSQL2 with the *WITH NORECOVERY * option.
trans-unit.target: Create a database on ContosoSQL1 called MyDB1, take both a full backup and a log backup, and restore them on ContosoSQL2 with the *WITH NORECOVERY * option.

trans-unit.source: Create the availability group endpoints on the SQL Server VMs and set the proper permissions on the endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Create the availability group endpoints on the SQL Server VMs and set the proper permissions on the endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Create the availability replicas.
trans-unit.target: Create the availability replicas.

trans-unit.source: Finally, create the availability group and join the secondary replica to the availability group.
trans-unit.target: Finally, create the availability group and join the secondary replica to the availability group.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: You have now successfully implemented SQL Server AlwaysOn by creating an availability group in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You have now successfully implemented SQL Server AlwaysOn by creating an availability group in Azure.

trans-unit.source: To configure a listener for this availability group, see <link><linkText>Configure an ILB listener for AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To configure a listener for this availability group, see <link><linkText>Configure an ILB listener for AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For other information about using SQL Server in Azure, see <link><linkText>SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For other information about using SQL Server in Azure, see <link><linkText>SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
